rtega_mnemonic:
涉涉RS
渉渉		wade, cross, involve
  • RS. footprints 步 in water 氵: wade; an involving task
heisig_constituent: ford, water, water droplets, water pistol, walk, stop, footprint, few
heisig_story: To ford a body of water means to walk across it.
koohiiStory1: The new Ford Jesus. It can do everything except WALK on WATER.
koohiiStory2: A ford is a place where one can walk through the water, a place only a few footsteps deep.
jp_example_words:
干渉(かんしょう): interference, intervention
交渉(こうしょう): negotiations, discussions, connection
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A tsunami is coming, and you want to walk over it, so you have to ford it. Think about it – you ford a river, you ford anything that’s water, unless you’re Jesus – you’re not Jesus. You don’t walk across a tsunami, you ford it.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imaging taking your shoes off, hiking up your pants, and holding all of your things above your head as you ford across the tsunami.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Your ability to ford this tsunami impresses everyone who witnesses it, especially the Shougun (しょう). Now that you've taught him a tsunami can be forded, he's going to start sending his troops through them instead of waiting for them to pass.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Your new fording techniques have increased the Shougun's military power! Congrats, I guess.
Ru_Meaning: ford, go cross, transit, ferry, import, involve
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 捗 (はかどる、ショウ продвигаться, идти вперёд)
Ru_Words:
交渉こうしょう
  • переговоры, обсуждение
  • отношение, связь, касательство
    • warodai
    干渉かんしょう
  • вмешательство
    • JR-EDICT
    渉外しょうがい
  • международные отношения, внешние связи (между различными, организациями как внутри государства, так и за границей)
    • warodai
    内交渉ないこうしょう
  • предварительные (неофициальные) переговоры
    • warodai
    武力干渉ぶりょくかんしょう
  • [вооружённая] интервенция
    • warodai
    渉水禽しょうすいきん
  • болотная птица
    • warodai
    徒渉所としょうじょ
  • брод
    • warodai
    徒渉りかちわたり
  • переход вброд
    • warodai
    性交渉せいこうしょう
  • sexual relations
    • EDICT2
Ru_Radicals: ノ, 小 (маленький), 汁 (суп), 止 (останавливать)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: where you can walk (歩) in the water (氵) is a ford

Name meaning

shè
яп. вм. 涉
Radicals: 氵, 歩  (tsunami, walk)
Meaning Mnemonic
A tsunami is coming, and you want to walk over it, so you have to ford it. Think about it – you ford a river, you ford anything that’s water, unless you’re Jesus – you’re not Jesus. You don’t walk across a tsunami, you ford it.
Imaging taking your shoes off, hiking up your pants, and holding all of your things above your head as you ford across the tsunami.
Reading Mnemonic
Your ability to ford this tsunami impresses everyone who witnesses it, especially the Shougun (しょう). Now that you've taught him a tsunami can be forded, he's going to start sending his troops through them instead of waiting for them to pass.
Your new fording techniques have increased the Shougun's military power! Congrats, I guess.
